alert.note: Alert for Tooele (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 1:29PM MDT until June 08 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...In the Rush Valley in Tooele County, especially north of Vernon near Faust. * WHEN...Until 430 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 128 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.25 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Boulter Creek, North Oak Brush Creek, Red Pine Creek, Dry Creek, Government Creek, Sabie Creek, Hickman Creek and Faust Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vernon, Tooele Army Depot South, Rush Valley and Faust.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
